column4: gyaresu,what u mean by by-uuid it shows me no file or directory
yes.
appear how? from command line? running what prog?
the drive doesnt appear on the desktop
do you know how to use the command line?
i know but i need to mount it automatically editing fstab
so 'sudo fdisk -l' sees it fine?
it shows me correct
and so have you entered an fstab entry and marked it as 'auto'
the other drives mount with out that option
so do you want it to automount or not?
exactly i want it
so why would you not put 'auto' in your fstab?
i mean the other drives that appear automatically doesnt have auto
your point?
i think shud i chage UUID in fstab?
ls -l /dev/disk/by-uuid/
'ls -l /dev/disk/by-uuid/'
that's were you find the UUID needed for fstab
go it :))
shud i now edit fstab
brb
